textBeforeTable: Below is a selection from the "Customers" table: In this tutorial we will use the well-known Northwind sample database. Demo Database The OR operator displays a record if either the first condition OR the second condition is true. The AND operator displays a record if both the first condition AND the second condition are true. The SQL AND & OR Operators The AND & OR operators are used to filter records based on more than one condition. Next Chapter » « Previous SQL AND & OR Operators SQL Quiz SQL Quiz SQL Hosting SQL Quick Ref SQL Format() SQL Now() SQL Round() SQL Len() SQL Mid() SQL Lcase() SQL Ucase() SQL Having SQL Group By SQL Sum() SQL Min() SQL Max() SQL Last() SQL First() SQL Count() SQL Avg() SQL Functions
textAfterTable: AND Operator Example The following SQL statement selects all customers from the country "Germany" AND the city "Berlin", in the "Customers" table: Example SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE Country='Germany' AND City='Berlin'; Try it yourself » OR Operator Example The following SQL statement selects all customers from the city "Berlin" OR "München", in the "Customers" table:  Example SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE City='Berlin' OR City='München'; Try it yourself » Combining AND & OR You can also combine AND and OR (use parenthesis to form complex expressions). The following SQL statement selects all customers from the country "Germany" AND the city must be equal to "Berlin" OR "München", in the "Customers" table: Example SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE Country='Germany' AND (City='Berlin' OR City='München'); Try it yourself » « Previous Next Chapter » W3SCHOOLS EXAMS HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, jQuery, and XML Certifications
